Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Impact of Adjusted Donor Lung Weight on Primary Graft Dysfunction in Lung Transplantation

Participants.evidence: 194 bilateral lung transplantations conducted at Sahlgrenska University Hospital, Sweden, from January 2014 to May 2021

Objective.evidence: This study examines the association between adjusted donor lung weight and PGD outcomes.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of PGD (grades II and III) within 72 hours post-transplant.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Due to the retrospective nature, randomisation and blinding were not applicable.

Blinding.evidence: Due to the retrospective nature, randomisation and blinding were not applicable.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The "high-weight" group exhibited a significantly higher incidence of PGD (22.9%) compared to the "low-weight" group (8.9%) (p = 0.020).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were not specifically reported.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration was not applicable due to the retrospective design.

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by Sahlgrenska University Hospital foundations, The Gothenburg Society of Medicine, and the Swedish Heart-Lung Foundation.
